title: Tips for finding fonts
content:
Hi all,

Can anyone share their tips on sourcing fonts, I have a specific shape I need for two letters (c and f), I may have to create them in illustrator, but wanted to check if whats out there, so, can anyone give advice on how to find fonts, is it a case of just putting the time in on font sites, I find that I can spend days doing this, there are so many, the categories help to a certain degree.

Appreciate any help.

Thanks
author: reboot

comments.content: maybe rough sketch them and upload a bitmap to "what the font" at myfonts.com

You can try Identifont instead -- not always that accurate, but it can narrow things down a little. It will ask you a series of questions about the face you're looking for, like "Serif or sans?" or "Is the crossbar on the A angled or straight?".

[http://www.identifont.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194855/http:/www.identifont.com/ "http://www.identifont.com/")

Hi Lee,

do a sketch and throw it to the beasts of the [Typophile Type ID Board](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194855/http:/typophile.com/forum/29). ;-)

In addition to the services mentioned above, there’s [TypeNavigator](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194855/http:/typenav.fontshop.com/) by FontShop.  
Here’s a good article on finding fonts: [http://ilovetypography.com/2007/08/19/identify-that-font/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023194855/http:/ilovetypography.com/2007/08/19/identify-that-font/ "http://ilovetypography.com/2007/08/19/identify-that-font/")  
F
Thanks for the help, I am currently sketching away :)
